definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to sew/to stitch together/to combine/to link/to connect/to put words together/to compose/to embellish

sentences.english: The exaggerated bosom ornament, big black feathers joss-stick shoulder white dew.
sentences.chinese: 胸前点缀夸张的黑色羽毛，大露雪白香肩。

sentences.english: The plates are barred with blue stripes round the edge .
sentences.chinese: 盘子的边上点缀着蓝边。

sentences.english: Argent flowers were dotted among phoenixes.
sentences.chinese: 鸾鸟中间点缀着银色的花枝。

sentences.english: Without a little utilitarian, to see white clouds dotted blue screen.
sentences.chinese: 不带一点功利地，看白云点缀蓝幕。

sentences.english: After the rain when it is sunny again, layers of clouds make the sky look very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴，层层云锦把天空点缀得很美丽。

sentences.english: An exquisite flower adorned her dress.
sentences.chinese: 她的上衣上别一枚别致的胸花做为点缀。

sentences.english: The space is dotted with various types of houses and tradesman 's workshops with their messy yards.
sentences.chinese: 其间还点缀着各种住宅和商人的店铺和各式院子。

sentences.english: Colorful ribbons are embellishing this world of variety.
sentences.chinese: 绚丽的彩带，点缀世界万象色彩。

sentences.english: And in the sky above, her starry backdrop.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了高空星光点缀的天幕。

sentences.english: Hill and woods diversify the landscape.
Taking advantage of abstract line, brilliant color and high-sounding intersperse reveals luxurious feature.
sentences.chinese: 抽象的线条，大胆的颜色和夸张的点缀尽显致奢华。

sentences.english: As to my sister, that bracelet is a an ornament at some time.
sentences.chinese: 对于姐姐来说，那对银镯是偶尔的装饰和点缀。

sentences.english: Now it's the right anthesis, red dots sprinkle everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 现在正是木棉花开的季节，到处都被红点点缀着。

sentences.english: There was the vast sea with many little green islands on it.
sentences.chinese: 浩瀚的大海中点缀着许多绿色的小岛。

sentences.english: The countersign of the bill are five- point stars that are dotted everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 此钞暗号是点缀在其各处的五角星。

sentences.english: Madame Lamotte was in black with touches of lilac colour.
sentences.chinese: 拉摩特太太穿的黑衣服，加上一点淡紫的点缀。

definition: the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
variant of 別緻|别致[bie2 zhi4]
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
to add the finishing touch (abbr. for 畫龍點睛|画龙点睛[hua4 long2 dian3 jing1])
